doc.str: System and method for cleaning contaminated matter comprising dioxins and preparation for decomposing dioxins

A reaction tank (5) holds crushed cells comprising a pellicle of Bacillus midousuji cultured in the presence of a chlorinated aromatic compound such as dioxins and holds wastewater comprising a contaminated matter such as fly ash which comprises dioxins and which is produced by washing of a facility such as an incinerator. Air is supplied by a blower (6) to a matter held in the reaction tank (5). Accordingly, dioxins having three or more chlorine atoms in the contaminated matter can be decomposed, and the contaminated matter can be easily cleaned at a site where dioxins generate such as a washing or dismantling site of an incineration facility.

Notice of Reason for Rejection issued May 19, 2009 in Corresponding Japanese Patent Appl. No. 2004-08553 with English translation. cited by other . | Yuichiro Otsuka, et al.; Research on Decomposing Function s of Novel Chlorinated Dioxin-Decomposing Microorganisms; Summary of Annual Meeting of Japan Society for Bioscience, Biotechnology, and Agrochemistry, Mar. 5, 2003; p. 82 (with English translation); vol. 2003; Japan. cited by other. | Masaya Nakamura, Shojiro Hishiyama, Yuichiro Ohtsuka, Takashi Kobayashi, Yoshihiro Katayama; Screening of Dioxin Decomposing Micro-Organism by a Novel Dioxin Analogous Compound; The Journal of Nippon Nogei Kagaku Kai; Mar. 2001; p. 153. cited by other . | Sadayori Hoshina, Midori Kono, Horoshi Goda, Toru Furuichi; Dioxins Decomposition Experiments by Thermophilici Microorganism, and Analysis of Gene Thereof; Proceedings of the 10.sup.th Annual Conference of The Japan Society of Waste Management Experts; Oct. 26-28, 1999; Ohmiya Sonic City. cited by other .
